The Seoul Queer Culture Festival (SQCF) is an annual summer event held in Seoul, with the vision of creating a space where people of diverse identities, including sexual orientation and gender identity, can come together and enjoy in an equal and inclusive manner. The festival, which started in 2000 under the name Queer Culture Festival - Rainbow 2000, has evolved over the years and was renamed as the Seoul Queer Culture Festival in 2018. It aims to be a comprehensive, open, and cultural event.The festival is organized and hosted by the Seoul Queer Culture Festival Organizing Committee, comprised of voluntary citizen participants. The main events of the festival include the Seoul Queer Parade and the Korean Queer Film Festival, along with various other events that take place throughout the festival period.

The Seoul Queer Parade (SQP) is an open and cultural event held annually in the heart of the city, with the aim of raising visibility for sexual minorities, promoting human rights, enjoying culture, and fostering self-esteem. It is part of the Pride Parade movement that takes place in numerous cities worldwide.The event consists of various programs, including booths, stages, and the parade itself.The Seoul Queer Culture Festival Organizing Committee, composed of voluntary citizen participants, organizes the Seoul Queer Parade, while the Seoul Queer Parade Executive Committee, an internal body, takes charge of the event management.For the 24th Seoul Queer Parade in 2023, recruitment is open for individuals who wish to actively participate in the event's operation as volunteers, divided into different teams based on their respective activities. We look forward to welcoming those who will join us in spreading rainbows across the streets of Seoul.

ì„œìš¸í€´ì–´ë¬¸í™”ì¶•ì œ ì¸ìŠ¤íƒ€ê·¸ë¨ @sqcforg ì—ì„œ ë‹¤ë¥¸ í•„í„°ë“¤ë„ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ ë³¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹µë‹ˆë‹¤.

4. ì°¸ì—¬ ì™„ë£Œ!

Host a Pride Parade wherever and whenever!

Pride Parade (also known as Pride March or Pride Festival) is a festival that can be held anywhere and at any time, serving as a public space to convey messages of diversity, equality, and inclusivity in Korean society.

When we, as LGBTQ+ individuals, feel a sense of pride, can't we call that experience a Pride Parade? And can't we refer to that gathering place as a plaza? In that case, couldn't our lives, our everyday existence, become a Pride March/Pride Parade in itself?

If it can't be done at Seoul Plaza, let's cover every corner of South Korea with Pride Parades. Let's all become Pride Marchers and organize an even larger Pride Parade.

Through the #MyWayIsPride campaign, share messages of pride, upload your Pride Parade photos, and plant Pride Pickets across various locations in South Korea. Let's be witnesses for each other. 

 Rainbows will surely appear!
 

 [How to participate]
 

 Access the campaign website.
 Click on Join Now!
 Register your banner (picket)!
 My Message (required): Write the message you want to convey.
 Address (optional): If you write Seoul as the city, your picket will be registered at Seoul City Hall. 
This way, you can register down to the neighborhood level.
 Photo (optional): You can upload certification photos. How about using the Radiant Rainbow Road 
Instagram filter from the Online Queer Parade 2022?
 You can also try other filters on the Seoul Queer Culture Festival Instagram account @sqcforg.
 

 Participation complete!

When I used to participate in Pride Fairs in the past, I created the Rightnow Project to produce badges and other items. It was not only about taking significant actions but also finding small tasks that could be accomplished immediately, believing that they could have a great impact when combined. While contemplating how to make better use of the archive I created, I decided to include a camera feature with a symbolic meaning. I will strive to create an archive that can be more conveniently utilized in the future. Thank you.

How this quote resonates with you remains to be seen. In the midst of anxiety, worry, helplessness, and confusion floating in the air, we have decided to name this present moment Chaos for all bodies that are at odds with the era. In the era of chaos, rather than speaking of premature hope, we have chosen to confront our own worries and disasters, refusing to become accustomed to the current situation. We have decided to dismantle the fractured relationship between humans and nature. I will lean my anxiety on your shoulders, listen attentively to your concerns, extend my hand to your sense of helplessness, and alleviate my own confusion with our shared understanding. From our respective positions, you and I, each fighting our own chaos, have decided to connect ourselves ice-coldly to break down this present moment together.

LGBTQ Youth Crisis Support Center DDing Dong supports and protects sexual minority teens who confront crisis circumstances and guide them to live an independent life guaranteed of physical and mental well-being and self-esteem on ones sexual orientation and gender identity. DDing Dong plans to become a multi-purpose organization that helps queer teens to rest, play, have meals, sleep, wash up, study, learn about human rights and supports them to be independent. It will also strive to become a professional safe house that operates 24 hours.

Northwest Ho was founded based on the concerns of LGBTQ+ individuals who have been unable to seek timely help due to misconceptions, fear of outing, and the lack of support from various organizations or systems when they need medical assistance or help with their identities. Existing information was often scarce and difficult to find, causing anxiety and inconvenience. The existing community, which served as the foundation for information sharing, was closed-off, and there was no platform to share information with everyone. Additionally, individual experiences were sometimes mixed with unreliable or non-professional information, clouding the essence of the information. Northwest Ho was established to address these issues by providing accurate information and transparent sharing, which can help alleviate discomfort and anxiety. Currently, Northwest Ho primarily focuses on organizing and sharing information related to LGBTQ+ healthcare, counseling, lifestyle, and welfare. With the guidance of experts, our goal is to navigate through the sea of information, find accurate information, and make it easily accessible and transparent for everyone.

HaengSeongIn started as LGBT association of Korean University in 1997 and has changed its name to the current organisation, HaengSeongIn in 1998, and since then our organisation as one LGBT representative has been leading LGBT activity till now. Many gender diversities, such as Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender/Transexual and Intersexual come together to achieve the society respecting the human rights of minorities. Any heterosexuals who are in favour of minorities human rights are able to join our activism on equal terms. As the diversity is valued, all our members are endeavoring to enhance the human rights sensitivity of all of themselves with respecting each other so as to avoid any unintended-discriminations against other members, based on disease, education, age, gender, and sexuality.

Amidst neighboring countries that strictly prohibit homosexuality, Israel has been a beacon of light when it comes to LGBTQ+ rights. During the Pride Month celebration, an Israeli transgender woman stood in front of the camera. She expressed concern that the hard-won rights of LGBTQ+ individuals in Israel, achieved through the struggles against the country's most right-wing government in its history, might be eroded once again.

Recent figures show that more than 40 per cent of LGBT+ people will experience a significant mental health problem, compared to around 25 per cent of the whole population, and are more than twice as likely to have attempted suicide.

In this eye-opening film, young pop culture icon Olly Alexander explores why the gay community is more vulnerable to mental health issues, as he opens up about his own long-term battles with depression. As the outspoken frontman of British band Years and Years, Olly is a powerful voice on mental health, bullying and LGBT+ rights. He has broken taboos with music videos that celebrate queer identities and spoken openly about his own sexuality as well as his ongoing struggles with anxiety.

In the film, Olly joins young people on their journeys battling issues that parallel his own - from homophobic bullying to eating and anxiety disorders - and along the way he asks what can be done to address them.

2023ë…„ì—ëŠ” ì„ì§€ë¡œì—ì„œ ë§Œë‚©ì‹œë‹¤! í€´ì–´ë‚˜ë¼ í”¼ì–´ë‚˜ë¼!

Hello, this is Seoul Queer Parade Executive Committee. The 2023 24th Seoul Queer Parade will visit the participants in the Euljiro 2-ga area on July 1 with booths, stages, and marching programs. After twists and turns, the Seoul Queer Parade will continue this year as well. Just as we have never given up on anything in the past 23 years, this year we have not given up until the end. If the Seoul Metropolitan Government does not permit the use of Seoul Plaza, we disallow discrimination and hatred against LGBTI people through the Seoul Queer Parade.

The Euljiro area is located in the very heart of downtown Seoul. Major roads such as Sejong-daero, Sogong-ro, Namdaemun-ro, Ujeongguk-ro, Samil-daero, and Chungmuro â€‹â€‹pass through nearby, and it is also a place that responded most quickly and sensitively to changes in society, such as the first modern newspaper and hospital. And this year's Seoul Queer Parade will be held here, which was also used as a marching course for the Seoul Queer Parade.

We now have a new dream. I imagine what would happen to the world I want to live in. A world where you can build a family regardless of the gender of your loved one, a world where you can wear the clothes you want to wear without worry, a world where you can work and study with peace of mind regardless of your gender identity and sexual orientation, to your family and friends Imagine a world where you can proudly say who you are and who you like.

The venue has changed, but this year, we will continue to present booths with new and original events, stage performances with passion and pride, speeches of solidarity, and overflowing energy. All programs are being prepared, including the parade to be launched in downtown Seoul. Rainbow-colored official goods that can only be found this year are also being prepared. Commemorate this year's Seoul Queer Parade, and be sure to take it with you as a proof that you can live with pride for another year.

I hope that the fact that I am an LGBT person can be a source of pride. Let the world hear our bright smiles and cheerful laughter. There are so many people like us living in the world, so let's march together without fear. Let us know that the future of this world is with us. If more people join the Queer Parade, the world will surely become a better place to live. 

Let's meet in Euljiro in 2023! Bloom queer country!
